reviews.title: Searched for comfortable seat
reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights at Esplendor and did not agree with the other reviews. The hotel staff was wonderful and helpful. The location is good except when the wind blows and the dust frokm the dirt streets attacks you at full force. The breakfast was fine and the bus service to town at night also nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our complaint is that there wasn't one comfotable sofa or chair in the lobby. The rooms had no drawers or shelves to put your clothing and so you were living out of your suitcase. not my idea of fun.
reviews.title: Fabulous place, an amazing experience
Argentina's version of the W hotel
reviews.text: El Calafate was a wonderful destination.

we just returned from our honeymoon in Argentina. We spent 3 days in this fab hotel. The location is great, a short walk to the town, on top of the hill with amazing views of the surrounding area. The staff our exceptionally efficient and friendly, the rooms are spotless and luxurious in their style.
reviews.title: Great, Great Views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a suite at the Esplendor and it had great facilities, great views and the best housekeeping we have ever experienced. Our room wasn't just clean it was immaculate.
reviews.title: We liked it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff IS young (and rather charming and glamorous!) and we found everybody to be helpful and proactive: when we were checking out they had already called ahead to the airport to ensure our flight was on time. All our arrangements were handled without a hitch.
reviews.title: All dessed up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quality of food in the restaurant was above average - we had dinner there twice and would have done so again if there had been some kind of daily special that meant we didn't have to order again from the same menu. Breakfasts were excellent.
reviews.title: Disappointment

likes.disliked: — The location, service, food, dogs outside hotel, and major road outside hotel room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I imagine though that this hotel is not to everybody's taste. We loved its design and its furnishings but if your idea of comfort is chintz and overstuffed furniture (...and there's nothing wrong with that, if we were all the same life would be very dull!) then you're probably not going to enjoy your stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel with youth hostel flair

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I shared the sentiments of one reviewer about the barking dogs; they are annoying but it is absolutely beyond the control of the hotel, and I would imagine you would have the same experience wherever you stayed. Animal welfare in this whole town is a problem....there are dogs everywhere with limbs sticking out at odd angles where they have been broken and left to reset themselves. We also found a dead dog on our walk back through town one evening and even saw a motorist deliberately aiming his car at a dog. It beggars belief and if you're an animal lover you may well find el Calafate a little distressing. I certainly did.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, a respite from the town

reviews.text: Fantastic place. Their website pictures are right on. When you walk in the lobby you are really wowed! Its NEAT with the skins and antler lights and all the light from the windows. Plus when you see an apple computer table you know they are cool.
reviews.title: Fantastic Property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a fantastic suite with great views, big windows and a huge tub and shower. No complaints at all.
reviews.title: Loved teh Esplendor

reviews.text: You might think the local properties are on the lake but that is not true. This hotel sits on a hill overlooking the town and the lake. The views are great but the lake is a bit far. This is not an issue as you really don't go to the lake. The town is a short walk down hill.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the glacier tours you must get up early at this hotel because the pickups start here.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
Perfect View - Great People
reviews.text: I would easily stay here again. Can't imagine what you could complain about really. If you complain about the area's dust, you should just stay home. It's dusty everywhere down there.
